chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
l: lb

Goal:
l ⪯ l

Premises:
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_inv_nil : forall l : lb, ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil -> l ⪯ nil
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_inv_left : forall (x : bool) (l : lb), x :: l ⪯ nil -> x = ⟘ /\ l ⪯ nil
in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l
lb_mask_inv_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⪯ y :: m -> x ⪦ y /\ l ⪯ m
lb_mask_leb : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
lb_mask_inv_cons_nil : forall l : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ nil -> False
lb_mask_inv_cons_cons : forall l m : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ ⟘ :: m -> False
filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), filter f l = filter g l < -> map f l = map g l
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)) -> forall l : list A, P l
ZMicromega.ZChecker_sound : forall (w : ZMicromega.ZArithProof) (l : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z)), ZMicromega.ZChecker l w = ⟙ -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv BinNums.Z, Refl.make_impl (ZMicromega.eval_nformula env) l False
find_none : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A), find f l = None -> forall x : A, In x l -> f x = ⟘
Ring_polynom.mkZmon_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall (M : Ring_polynom.Mon) (j : BinNums.positive) (l : list R), req (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (Ring_polynom.mkZmon j M)) (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l (Ring_polynom.zmon j M))
Field_theory.fcons_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) (Fcons : Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), (forall (l : list R) (a : Ring_polynom.PExpr C) (l1 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l (Fcons a l1) -> ~ req (Ring_polynom.PEeval rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp phi Cp_phi rpow l a) rO /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul...
Field_theory.PCond_app : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (phi : C -> R) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) (l : list R) (l1 l2 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)), Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l (l1 ++ l2) < -> Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l1 /\ Field_theory.PCond rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req phi Cp_phi rpow l l2
BinList.jump_add : forall (A : Type) (i j : BinNums.positive) (l : list A), BinList.jump (BinPos.Pos.add i j) l = BinList.jump i (BinList.jump j l)
Ring_polynom.PNSubst1_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P1) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l (Ring_polynom.PNSubst1 cO cI cadd cmul ceqb cdiv P1 cM1 P2 n))
Ring_polynom.Mphi_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req ->...-> forall (P : Ring_polynom.Pol C) (cM : C * Ring_polynom.Mon) (l : list R), let (c, M) := cM in let (Q, R0) := Ring_polynom.MFactor cO cI ceqb cdiv P c M in req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P) (radd (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l Q) (rmul (rmul (phi c) (Ring_polynom.Mphi rO rI rmul l M)) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l R0)))
Ring_polynom.POneSubst_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall cdiv : C -> C ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P1) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P3)
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = ⟙
Ring_polynom.PNSubst_ok : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), Ring_theory.ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> forall cdiv : C -> C ->...-> req (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P1) (Ring_polynom.Pphi rO radd rmul phi l P3)

```coq
apply lb_mask_sind.
- intros l. apply in_lb_mask_0.
- intros l H. apply in_lb_mask_1. assumption.
- intros x y l m Hxy Hlm HI. apply in_lb_mask_2. assumption. assumption. Qed.
```

original: apply lb_mask_sind. - intros l. apply in_lb_mask_0. - intros l H. apply in_lb_mask_1. auto. - intros x y l m Hxy Hlm HI. apply in_lb_mask_2. auto. auto.
